catalog_info.title: Continuity and Discontinuity in Colonial Latin America
catalog_info.notes: Conducted in Spanish. Required for concentrators in the Hispanic Studies track (as an alternative to Spanish 71b), and for all concentrators in Latin American Studies.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: A score above 780 on the SAT II or the Harvard Placement test; a 50- or 60-level course in Spanish; or permission of course head.
catalog_info.description: An overview of literary and cultural production in the Americas before and after the Spanish invasion. Topics include pre-Columbian visual and verbal expressions; discovery, invention, conquest, and resistance; the historiography of the New World; native depictions of the colonial world.
